column4: I have tried different browsers, different java versions, opening ports on router
I am just lost I guess
I had to downgrade to 6.06 to get my wireless to work
I have gotten pretty familiar with iwconfig, ifconfig, and some basic linux commands
I love linux, but sometimes I wonder why I am so into wanting to run it
before I get too far into the java problem, does anybody know of an app that converts openoffice docs to ms office docs
I need to submit my school work in ms office format
ok cool
thanks guys
I guess I am office to banish any trace of java from ubuntu
If you feel so inclined, you could also use crossover office if you want to run MS Word through wine
dont have a legal office version
would rather do things atleast half way legal from now on
doing things legally should be the least of reasons for moving to linux
I have a lot of reasons, but I really like linux
Ahh... don't worry about it
Java is okay to install, just a few more steps. I have it running on my home debian server with azureus going just fine
what is azureus?
popular bit torrent client
Well, that's java for you... shitty all the way
I dont have a lot of problems on my windows machine, I still have problems, but it works most of the time anyway
Generally when you work with java virtual machine on any OS you are going to have little kinks here and there
